subtitle: unlike the traditional gospels this text
portrays Judas not as a villain but as a
close friend of Jesus who understood his
mission better than the other disciples
according to this gospel judas's
betrayal was actually part of a plan
orchestrated by Jesus himself to fulfill
his Destiny and a necessary step in
fulfilling a divine
plan according to this gospel Yeshua
also known as Jesus asked Judas to hand
him over to the authorities as it was
part of a larger plan for Jesus's
crucifixion and ultimate sacrifice for
Humanity in this episode we'll refer to
Jesus as Jesus but it's important to
note that his real name was Yeshua
similarly many other names we know from
the canonical Bible like Mark Luke and
John are in actuality English names and
all of Jesus's disciples were illiterate
and did not write the
gospels however the Gospel of Judas
